title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: fatal grimsby fire 'not sus police confirm .
scunthorpe steelworkers to decide on pension future .
'unprovoked ' attack in gainsborough aldi car park .

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: so that 's it for our live coverage from our lincolnshire newsroom today .
we 'll be back on wednesday from 08:00 .
in the meantime , have a very merry christmas and enjoy these five things we did n't know when the day began :
from all of us at bbc lincolnshire and the bbc news online team , merry christmas !
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : foggy lake view
text: just take a look at this christmas cracker of a
a foggy view of a lake in holton le moor taken by one of our weather watchers , beewise :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: christmas weather forecast : breezy and mild
text: if you 're dreaming of a white christmas then you 're almost certain to be disappointed in lincolnshire this year .
the weather forecast is predicting a mild , breezy and cloudy day on christmas eve ( sun ) and christmas day ( mon ) .
but if you 're out for christmas parties in the coming evenings you 're in luck , because we 're expecting lows of only eight degrees celsius up to christmas .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: ambulance service appeal after high number of calls
text: east midlands ambulance service has appealed for people to think twice before calling 999 this afternoon after a responding to a high number of calls .
emas say to `` please think 'is there an alternative service i could use ?
they recommend contacting your pharmacy , the nhs choices website or calling the non-emergency 101 number before 999 if it 's not an emergency .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: investment in body cameras after attacks on staff
text: there were more than 150 incidents where staff at hospitals in grimsby , goole and scunthorpe were attacked last year , according to the northern lincolnshire and goole nhs trust .
that is why it says security staff have been given hi-tech body cameras , to try and deter anti-social behaviour .
the cameras will be worn by the staff who patrol the hospitals and car parks , and have been bought by the security firm which employs them .
author: Jake Zuckerman
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: 'unexplained ' death couple named
text: a man and woman found dead in holbeach yesterday lunchtime are thought to be 75-year-old michael cobley and 46-year-old zanna ernstone .
the couple were found dead in a property in holbeach at midday yesterday .
police are treating the deaths as unexplained .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police appeal after football train disturbance
text: a train guard refused to travel on a train filled with grimsby town football fans because they were `` so drunk and overbearing '' .
the same journey also left a teenage girl and her grandmother scared to travel again after `` unwanted touching '' and `` lewd sexual comments '' from football fans .
fans were leaving on a train from lincoln to nottingham on saturday 16 december to watch grimsby town play notts county .
british transport police say passengers were throwing beer cans , taking photos of other passengers and rocked the train on its tracks .
they are appealing for witnesses .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: fourteen `` named and shamed '' for drink-driving
text: lincolnshire police have `` named and shamed '' 14 people for drink-driving since a new campaign began last week .
the force is publishing the names of those they 've breathalysed and found to be above the limit .
since their think do n't drink campaign began on saturday 16 december 14 people 's details have been published .
today four more men , aged between 22 and 32 , have been named .
they 'll appear at boston and lincoln magistrates ' court in the new year .

documents.title: dog seizures deterring hare coursers - police
text: a crackdown on suspected hare coursers - including the seizure of suspects ' dogs - is working , according to lincolnshire police .
officers are using laws which allow them to take away dogs for a day or longer if they 're part of a prosecution case .
in three months , 49 dogs have been taken away from suspected coursers , including barry ( above ) .
police forces from around the country say hare coursers have been put off travelling to lincolnshire to take part in the illegal sport .
the feedback other police forces are getting is that those hare coursers wo n't come to lincolnshire because of the risk of losing their dogs .
that 's a good thing for us . ''
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: sleaford school celebrates christmas song success
text: a festive song written by a lincolnshire school has made it into the top 100 christmas singles chart on itunes .
the song , a william alvey christmas , was made by pupils and staff at the school in sleaford .
chris clark , the teacher behind it , says the success has been amazing for the school :
it 's huge .
i think it 's definitely worthy of all the success , but as you know in this day and age it 's pretty difficult .
so to have some success without any backing is pretty amazing . ''
just because we can , let 's enjoy watching this impressive video and song again here :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: work begins on new grantham cinema
text: film fans in grantham rejoice !
work has begun on a multi-million pound leisure complex in the town which will include a five-screen cinema .
today it 's been announced that savoy cinemas , which runs boston 's west end cinema ( above ) , will operate the complex .
the site , on st catherine 's road , has been cleared and initial groundwork has started , but work will properly begin in the new year .
grantham has huge potential and we have been extremely keen to open a cinema here for some time .
we anticipate welcoming about 250,000 people through the doors every year , many of whom will visit the town centre . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: plan to triple number of lincolnshire hospital volunteers
text: a recruitment drive is being launched to triple the number of hospital volunteers in lincolnshire .
just under 300 people currently give their time to the county 's hospitals trust , which is now aiming to increase that number to 1,000 .
paul cartwright ( above ) won the trust 's volunteer of the year award and will be one of many working on christmas day .
i believe making a cup of tea is the world to some patients , and obviously talking to patients .
i just generally help , which obviously the nurses ca n't do because they 're so busy . ''

documents.title: church closure ahead of christmas is `` frustrating ''
text: the vicar of st swithin 's church in lincoln says it 's frustrating that they 've had to close their church ahead of christmas .
a potential defect in a ceiling panel has meant the church has closed for its christmas services whilst the roof is checked by experts .
the reverend jim prestwood says that the increased popularity of the church may have exacerbated some of its maintenance issues .
the congregation has increased from just ten attendees every sunday to 300 in three years .
the services will now be held at the all saints ' church on monk 's road in the city .

it is frustrating but on the other hand there 's a kind of irony that at a time of year when mary and joseph had nowhere to call home , here we are without a home , so there 's something maybe significant about worshipping in a place unfamiliar to us , and not as planned .
so there 's frustration but also some excitement around it as well bizarrely .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: car fire on holdingham roundabout
text: a car is currently on fire at the holdingham roundabout , near sleaford .
fire crews are at the scene .
the blaze is causing traffic delays on the a15 and a17 approaching the roundabout , as well as causing delays in sleaford town centre .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: holton-le-clay body identified as missing teenager
text: a body found in the village of holton-le-clay in lincolnshire last weekend has been identified as 19-year-old liam toner .
mr toner was reported missing after a night out in cleethorpes last friday .
his body was found by a roadside in holton-le-clay , where flowers have been laid as tribute .
tests have shown there were no sus circumstances , according to lincolnshire police .
officers will be working with colleagues in the humberside force to establish the circumstances surrounding his death .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: new owners for barton ropewalk
text: barton-upon-humber 's historic ropewalk building will be officially transferred to new owners today .
the arts and live music venue has been bought by the waterside artists ' co-operative after the group won a £ 100,000 grant from the heritage lottery fund .
the group , which has been running the centre since 2000 , says it secures the future of the grade ii-listed building .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'save a life ' cpr campaign nears 20,000 target
text: did you know that bbc radio lincolnshire 's save a life campaign has so far trained just under 20,000 people in the lifesaving skill of cpr ?

and now the radio station wants your help to cross the finish line - and you can help reach the 20,000 mark by visiting bbc radio lincolnshire 's hq today and be trained in cpr by lives first responders .
the save a life scheme started after bbc radio lincolnshire newsreader charlotte wright suffered a cardiac arrest while jogging in the uphill area of lincoln in november 2016 .
the newsreader was saved by passers-by who performed cpr until medics arrived .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: deadline day for british steel pension decision
text: british steel workers in scunthorpe have until today to make a decision about the future of their pensions .
more than 120,000 workers have had to choose between two new pension plans .
there had been calls to put the deadline back over concerns about poor financial advice and tight deadlines .

documents.title: woman dies in fatal grimsby fire
text: a woman in her 30s died in a house fire in grimsby yesterday , police have confirmed .
the fire started in the living room of a house on baroness road at about 15:30 on thursday .
police say they 're not treating the blaze as sus

documents.title: investigation into grimsby house fire death
text: an investigation in to the cause of a house fire which left one person dead is under way .
fire crews were sent to the fire which started in the living room of a property on baroness road yesterday afternoon .
no details about the victim have been disclosed by the fire service .

documents.title: 'unprovoked ' attack in aldi car park
text: a man in his 50s has been left with bruises and swelling in what police are calling a `` vicious unprovoked assault '' in a supermarket car park .
the attack happened on friday 8 december at 17:30 as the man was trying to exit aldi 's supermarket in gainsborough .
police say a boy blocked his path and after the driver got out of his car the boy allegedly struck him .
police say there would have been numerous witnesses they 'd like to talk to .

documents.title: scunthorpe steelworkers to decide on pension future
text: british steel workers in scunthorpe have until today to make a decision about the future of their pension .
workers have to choose between two new pension plans .
there were calls to put the deadline back over concerns about poor financial advice .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: investigations continue into holbeach deaths
text: investigations are continuing this morning into the unexplained deaths of two people in holbeach .
a man and a woman were found in a bungalow on wilder 's garth in the town at midday yesterday .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: church closes ahead of christmas services
text: a church in lincoln has been forced to close temporarily because of `` unforeseen maintenance issues '' .
staff at st swithin 's say people 's safety is their main priority and experts are thoroughly checking the building .
they 're looking for alternative arrangements for their christmas services .
our deepest apologies to those affected by this - we are doing all we can !
for everyone else , we hope you will join us over the christmas period as , although the venue might change , the reason for gathering does n't . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : your christmas weekend weather forecast
text: here 's your forecast for the friday before christmas and the coming weekend :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning and welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: good morning from our lincolnshire newsroom .
it 's harry here and i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18:00 today .
we 'd love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: one dead in living room house fire
text: one dead in living room house fire

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me for today - we 'll be back from 08.00 with more live updates and breaking news , sport and travel will appear here throughout the night .
just before i go - let 's look back at five things we 've learned today :
bye for now
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : staying mild overnight
text: some patchy rain and drizzle tonight and temperatures higher than average for the time of year .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: lorry fire caused by brake dust
text: the a16 louth bypass was closed this lunchtime - because of what police described as a vehicle fire .
here 's the latest from lincolnshire fire and rescue :
12:29hrs crews attended hgv fire in louth .
sdbf to one wheel housing .
cause build up of dust .

documents.title: new car park one of country 's safest
text: lincoln 's newest car park has already been named one of the country 's safest despite only opening just over a month ago
the city of lincoln council which built the new lincoln central car park as part of the new £ 30m transport hub project - unveiled the park mark award earlier today .
before a car park can receive the award , it undergoes a series of rigorous tests by specially trained police assessors .
a car park is assessed on several factors such as location , personal safety , lighting , absence of graffiti , ability to find a space easily and more .

documents.title: traders blanket approach to emergency
text: if you 're in louth doing your christmas shopping over the next few days you might see this poster in some of the windows .
it shows that the trader is part of a new scheme - which aims to help people if they have an illness or injury on the street .
it 's been thought up by the louth independent traders group .
they say they were inspired to take action after a recent incident where an elderly man fell in the street and was left waiting in the cold for an ambulance .
author: William Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: three fire engines at house fire in grimsby
text: humberside fire and rescue service are currently attending a house fire on baroness road in grimsby .
they were called at 15:36 after smoke was seen coming out of a window .
three fire engines arrived within six minutes .
it 's unclear at this stage what 's the cause of the fire and if anyone was in the house , firefighters are still at the scene .

documents.title: a180 to be partially closed overnight
text: several heavy goods vehicles were involved in a crash earlier this morning on the a180 near ulceby .
the incident happened around 08:00 this morning and the a180 westbound now has one lane open .

humberside police say the second lane of both the eastbound and westbound carriageways will remain closed from the a160 to barnetby top until the central reservation barrier can be repaired overnight .

documents.title: breakinginvestigation launched after bodies found
text: detectives have launched an inquiry this afternoon after two bodies were discovered at a property in holbeach .
lincolnshire police say they 're treating the deaths as unexplained .
officers were called to the address in willder 's garth just after noon today .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: look carefully - it 's a festive phone box
text: we 're used to people finding novel uses for rural phone boxes - libraries , book exchanges , homes for community defibrillators and so on .
but how about this ?
people in swinderby , near lincoln , have used theirs to display the village christmas tree
love the christmas tree in a phone box in swinderby .
pcso sarah
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: 120 properties without power in east riding and grimsby
text: around 120 properties are without power near hessle , cottingham and grimsby .
northern powergrid say it 's due to an unexpected problem with the electricity cables which serve each area .
they estimate that the power will be restored at properties near hessle around 16:00 , properties in grimsby around 17:45 and cottingham around 20:00 .

documents.title: council voices frustration over high street refurb delays
text: council highways bosses have spoken of their frustration over delayed work to a flagship project in lincoln city centre .
contractor north midland construction said yesterday it would not be able to complete the improvement work on the city 's high street before christmas as promised .
the project had originally been scheduled to finish in time for the city 's christmas market , but was not ready .
temporary surfacing has been put down .
john monk , who 's in charge of the scheme between st marks and st mary 's street , says he 's not happy with the situation :
it 's not ideal by any means .
it 's not what we wanted and it 's not what the contractor wanted . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: thousands of homeless young people seek council help
text: thousands of young people in the yorkshire and humber region asked councils for help last year because they had no home , it 's emerged .
figures obtained by the youth charity centrepoint show nearly 3,000 16 to 25-year-olds approached their local council because they were homeless or at risk of homelessness .

documents.title: parrot sanctuary 's expansion plan takes flight
text: a parrot sanctuary in lincolnshire is having to expand because of a rise in the number of unwanted birds .
the lincolnshire wildlife park plans to add a £ 250,000 building to its site near boston because it 's running out of space .
staff at the attraction , in friskney , say they 've seen a 250 % increase in the number of birds brought to them by people who no longer want their pets in the last 12 months .
this plan was actually in the planning for next year and we 've realised we need to build it this year .
every bird that arrives here has a cost . ''
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: appeal over man who failed to appear at court
text: police are asking people to watch out for jason frow who failed to appear at court earlier today .
the 24-year-old , from lincoln , was due to face magistrates in the city on a charge of vehicle theft .
anyone with information about his whereabouts is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy , damp and mild afternoon
text: here 's the forecast for lincolnshire - a pretty murky afternoon to come on what is the shortest day of the year :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from across lincolnshire so far this lunchtime include :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: crime commissioner focuses on missing people
text: more than 3,500 cases of missing people have been reported in lincolnshire in the past 12 months , with two thirds of cases involving children .
marc jones ( lincolnshire 's police and crime commissioner , says the numbers are staggering and put significant pressure on officers .
he says the force is now using drones to try and locate missing people .
mr jones made his comments after a woman renewed her appeal for information about her missing father , 19 years after his disappearance .
tessa capon is still desperate for information about her father andrew , from grantham , who went missing on a night out in skegness in 1998 .
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: traffic starting to move again after a180 crash
text: traffic which has been stuck on the westbound carriageway on the a180 near ulceby is getting moving again .
earlier today , there was a crash on the road involving several heavy goods vehicles and which saw three people suffer minor injuries .
drivers closest to the crash are starting to be moved on again after being stuck for about three hours .
the westbound carriageway still remains closed and drivers are being advised to avoid the area .
drivers close to it were just feeling lucky .
it did n't matter about the time and we were so pleased to hear there had been no serious injuries . ''

documents.title: only minor injuries after a180 crash
text: there were no serious injuries after a crash on the a180 near immingham earlier today , humberside fire and rescue service has confirmed .
several heavy goods vehicles were involved and the police say three people suffered minor injuries .
drivers are still being advised to avoid the area , though , as the road is still closed westbound .
meanwhile , only one carriageway is currently open eastbound on the road near ulceby :
thankfully no-one seriously injured this morning on a180 .
timely and effective multi-agency response to the four vehicle rtc with @ twitterid and @ twitterid thanks to other drivers for their patience during the long delays .
bloody tractors

documents.title: woman raped in louth town centre
text: detectives are warning residents to be vigilant and to report anything sus after the rape of a woman in louth .
the incident happened in the town centre between 19:00 and 20:00 on wednesday 13 december after a woman in her 30s was approached in the mercer row area .
the suspect is described as in his 30s , tall , with short , light coloured hair and stubble .
he was wearing a tracksuit top which had triangles on the sleeves and white borders around them .
detectives are appealing for information and want to speak to anyone who witnessed a struggle or anything out of the ordinary on wednesday evening .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: one lane open on a180 eastbound
text: there are still some delays around the a180 near ulceby after several heavy goods vehicles were involved in a crash this morning .
so far , we know three people have suffered minor injuries .
one lane on the eastbound carriageway has reopened , but the westbound carriageway remains closed :
1 lane of the a180 has reopened ( eastbound )

documents.title: thousands of young people stuck in 'sofa surfing ' cycle
text: more than 2,000 young people in lincolnshire have asked for help to escape from a life of `` sofa surfing '' , a major new bbc study has revealed .
in nearly 40 % of cases , it 's because they are thrown out of the parental home .
the bbc study found that young people in this situation often do not show up on official statistics , meaning the problem of homelessness may be worse that officials think .
the charity centrepoint said the bbc data corroborated its own research , carried out in 2014 by cambridge university .
co-author anna clarke said : `` sofa-surfing is a not an uncommon experience for young people in housing difficulties . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: a180 westbound carriageway still closed
text: police are trying to get drivers to use a different route after several heavy vehicles were involved in a crash on the a180 near ulceby .
so far we know three people have suffered minor injuries .
the immingham wolds community policing team is trying to get people to use the a18 instead :
we are unsure how long the a180 westbound will be closed and ulceby is extremely busy .
another alternate route would be via the stallingborough interchange and join the a18 .
i understand why this happened , i encountered lorries braking hard and swerving lanes due to a tractor doing 15mph on a foggy night on the same stretch at 6 last night .
tractors should be banned from motorways !
good job my brakes work well
thank god for common sense ! !
our houses are shaking with lorries thundering by .
cant even cross the road !
loads better comms than last time so and ulceby is apparently totally gridlocked with hgvs struggling past shops etc .
the a18 was busy but moving well when i went through .

documents.title: more emergency services arriving at a180 crash
text: around three or four heavy goods vehicles are involved in a crash on the a180 near ulceby .
so far we know there are three minor injuries but more emergency services are arriving at the scene .
@ twitterid still arriving at scene on a180 .

documents.title: school closed after power cut
text: one of gainsborough 's biggest schools is closed today after a power cut .
a major failure yesterday meant the school had to cancel its christmas production of bugsy malone .
pupils are being asked to stay at home - staff are at work as usual .
a decision will be made later on whether tonight 's performance will go ahead .

documents.title: a180 crash : more from scene
text: it looks like the crash on the a180 could cause problems for some time .
here 's the latest from the police :
re log 97 - diversions are going to be put in place in due course .
please tune in to local media and traffic alerts for updates on this incident .
we will of course try and put as much detail as we can on here , other work permitting # 9523

documents.title: traffic and travel : major crash on a180
text: a warning if you 're heading out on the a180 in northern lincolnshire this morning :
control - crews from scunthorpe & immingham attending an rtc eastbound a180 between the a15 & a160. # redwatch

documents.title: watch : a murky start and mild
text: cloudy and grey for most areas with outbreaks of mainly light rain in the morning .
here 's my full forecast :

Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: man , 88 , dies in house blaze
text: man , 88 , dies in house blaze

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: it 's goodbye from me for today - but we 'll be back from 08.00 tomorrow with more live updates .
breaking news , travel and sport will appear here throughout the night .
meanwhile , let 's look back at five things that have happened during the day :
bye for now
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: anger over louth vandal attacks costing thousands
text: a spate of vandalism at a lincolnshire beauty spot is being investigated .
hubbards hills , in louth , has been targeted several time in recent weeks .
in the latest incident , a ramp for people with disabilities has been damaged , with the estimated cost of repairs being about £ 10,000 .
i ca n't see anybody getting any enjoyment out of doing it and do they realise how many people are going to be deprived of that access ? ''

documents.title: watch : sprout and about - brussels harvest well under way
text: i 've been out in lincolnshire with the crews harvesting the sprouts set to grace many a christmas dinner table across the country - and it 's hard work .
lincolnshire 's veg is in high demand over christmas .
here 's a rundown of what we produce as a county for the festive dinner table :
basically , the country could n't do christmas without lincolnshire !
you can see how the sprout harvest is carried out right here :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: warning over fire danger of illegal cigarettes
text: people are being warned over the dangers of being burned in their beds after 44,000 illegal cigarettes were seized in scunthorpe .
many of the counterfeit cigarettes found by north lincolnshire trading standards were n't self extinguishing - the kind blamed for some house fire deaths .
the illegal stash was found in three shops on frodingham road and cemetery road .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: fatal sleaford house fire 'not sus
text: here 's a statement from lincolnshire police about the fatal fire in sleaford earlier :
`` we can confirm an 88-year-old man has died at his home on claremont park , sleaford .
`` a woman , also in her 80s , was taken to hospital with injuries relating to the fire .
her injuries are not thought to be serious .
`` the incident is not being treated as su and a file will be passed to the coroner . ''
the fire broke out at the bungalow at about 07:20 this morning .
fire officers are still investigating the cause .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: injunction granted to stop travellers
text: a council in lincolnshire has successfully applied for an injunction to stop travellers repeatedly pitching camp alongside a main road through the county .
sleaford-based north kesteven district council says the high court in birmingham has granted the order for byard 's leap , on the a17 .
the authority says there has been persistent unauthorised caravan camping on this stretch of the high dike and at least two encampments on the land each year .
by taking out an injunction on the land we are further protecting our green space in the district .
we have acted quickly to prevent any travellers returning to the site , and hope this sends a clear message to anyone who was thinking of using unauthorised camping sites in the area . ''

documents.title: new year rail strikes in rmt guards row
text: rail passengers across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire are set to be hit with further strike action .

members of the rmt union at six companies - arriva rail north , southern , south western railway , greater anglia , merseyrail and the isle of wight 's island line - are to stage a series of 24-hour walkouts in january .
it 's part of a long-running dispute about the role of guards .
the union said it had tried to resolve the disputes , which it has insisted are about safety .

documents.title: breakingman dies after fire at sleaford bungalow
text: a man has died in a fire at his home in sleaford , police have just confirmed .
the victim was rescued from the bungalow , on claremont park , off lincoln road , this morning but died later in hospital .
a woman who was also at the address escaped on her own .
fire crews were called to the blaze at about 07:20 this morning .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police appeal over 'juice ' graffiti tag
text: can you help stop graffiti vandals in lincoln ?
lincolnshire police have put out an appeal this afternoon :
this tag keeps appearing more and more across the south of the city .
please call 101 if you have any information or see it happening .

documents.title: rare wave cloud formation spotted
text: rare wave cloud formation spotted

documents.title: lincoln city centre refurb work delayed - again
text: the completion of a revamp of lincoln high street has been postponed for a second time .
the project , which is costing taxpayers about £ 800,000 , is supposed to see one of the city 's main shopping areas repaved .
the scheme , between st mary 's street and tentercroft street ( was supposed to be finished before lincoln christmas market at the beginning of december .
but it was put off by contractor north midland construction and temporary asphalt surfacing was laid .
it was promised then that the work would be done by christmas .
but now that deadline has also been missed because of `` freezing temperatures '' , according to north midland construction .
it 's hoped the work will now be completed in the new year .
author: Seb Tiley
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: hare coursing crackdown in lincolnshire
text: i 'm out today with police officers who are clamping down on hare coursing in lincolnshire .
they 've been stopping suspects in the south of the county , confiscating dogs and moving hare coursers on .
but before they leave , the police are telling them to clean up their cars :
a so-called dispersal order is in place to allow police to move on groups of suspected coursers .
but in order to make any arrests police have to catch them in the act - which is very difficult .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: ambulance staff 'fear assaults daily '
text: paramedics working in lincolnshire over christmas say they fear being assaulted on a daily basis .
there have been more than 470 reported assaults on east midlands ambulance service ( emas ) staff over the past seven months .
emas has put the figures out this week because it 's one of their busiest of the year .
the service is urging people celebrating christmas to drink sensibly .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: appeal to find wanted man
text: have you seen andrew prince ?
he 's wanted in relation to a stabbing in eastbourne , but police believe he may currently be in lincolnshire .
sussex and lincolnshire police have joined forces to ask for people 's help in locating the 20-year-old after a man was attacked in eastbourne in october .
he is also wanted on a warrant after failing to appear at hastings magistrates ' court for possession of an offensive weapon .
officers believe he may be in the boston or spalding areas and are asking for anyone with information to get in touch .

documents.title: hot ashes warning after lincoln fire
text: firefighters in lincoln were called to a blaze in the early hours of this morning caused by hot ashes in a wheelie bin .
there was damage to the outside of the house in burton road , with gutters melted and fencing burned , according to a lincolnshire fire and rescue service spokesman .
the incident happened at about 04:00 this morning .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather this lunchtime
text: generally cloudy with hill fog and light rain is possible in some areas .
a better chance of bright spells in the east , and then also in the north during the afternoon .
feeling rather mild with light winds .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: daughter 's anger after van breaks up funeral procession
text: a grieving daughter was left in tears when her father 's funeral procession was forced to pull over as a highway maintenance driver overtook it .
lindsay stubbs said the driver broke into the cortege on the a16 near spalding as they made their way to the crematorium on 15 december .
`` i could not believe how disrespectful [ the driver ] was , '' she told the bbc .
she and her family now hope people will think twice about overtaking a funeral procession .
author: Gemma Dawson
BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today include :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: watch : lincolnshire village is uk 's 'most christmassy '
text: people in britain make more christmas internet searches than anywhere else in the world , according to internet giant google .
and the village of keelby , near caistor , made the most searches per person in the country according to the statistics .
so why is keelby so christmassy ?
we went to the village to find out :

documents.title: 'first team football at 16 but now i 'm becoming a man '
text: 'first team football at 16 but now i 'm becoming a man '
author: Ian Woodcock
BBC Sport

documents.title: police cordon in place at scene of sleaford fire
text: i 'm at the scene of a blaze at a house in sleaford where firefighters had to rescue a man earlier this morning .
police are guarding the scene at claremont park , off lincoln road , where the fire broke out at about 07:20 .
we know that one woman managed to get out of the affected property on her own .
meanwhile , a man had to be rescued by firefighters wearing breathing apparatus .
both are being treated in hospital and there are no details of their injuries yet .
author: Jake Zuckerman
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: amazing cloud formations spotted over lincolnshire
text: this looks like a painting - but it 's actually a photograph taken yesterday at swinhope , near market rasen .
it 's been sent to us via twitter by arlene towriss and i just could n't resist sharing it .
i 'm told the cloud formations are called kelvin helmholtz waves .
they 're named after scientists lord kelvin and hermann von helmholtz who studied the physics that lead to this beautiful type of cloud formation .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: two in hospital after sleaford house fire
text: two people have been taken to hospital following a house fire in sleaford this morning , according to lincolnshire fire and rescue .
three crews from sleaford , billinghay and metheringham were called to a home on claremont park , just off lincoln road , at about 07:20 .
a brigade spokesman said a woman escaped the property on her own , but fire crews had to rescue a man using breathing apparatus .
both were taken to hospital and no details have been released as yet about the extent of their injuries .
an investigation is under way into the cause of the fire .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: appeal after theft from shop in gainsborough
text: police in gainsborough are appealing for help to identify this man as they say he may be able to help with their enquiries into a theft :
officers say the theft took place on tuesday 5 december at the boots store in market place .
they 've released the cctv this morning and anyone with information about his identity is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: weather : a mild dry day
text: it will be a mild day but a misty and murky start .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: firefighters called to house blaze in sleaford
text: lincolnshire fire and rescue crews have been battling a house fire in sleaford this morning .
the blaze broke out at a house in lincoln road at about 07:00 .
more details when we get them .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'use it or lose it ' call on lincoln shuttle bus
text: lincoln 's steep hill shuttle bus will continue for at least six more months as bosses try to make it commercially viable without subsidies .
last month , both lincoln business improvement group and lincolnshire county council pulled funding from the service in favour of the city 's park and ride .
the service operates between the cathedral area and the city 's main shopping area , which is separated by the famous steep hill .
pc coaches , which operates the service , says it 's time to use it or lose it .
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: welcome to today 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so please get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: is the uk the most christmas obsessed country ?
text: is the uk the most christmas obsessed country ?
author: William Dahlgreen
BBC News

documents.title: patient defends liver-tagging surgeon
text: patient defends liver-tagging surgeon

documents.title: watch : are you living next door to a bengal tiger ?
text: venomous snakes , alligators and even a tiger .
hundreds of dangerous animals are being kept as pets in people 's homes across east yorkshire and lincolnshire .
but are we at risk ?
the rspca says current regulations are n't tough enough .
author: Jake Zuckerman
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me and the team in lincoln this afternoon , we 'll be back with more of the latest from across the county from 08.00 tomorrow .
breaking news , weather and travel updates will appear here throughout the night .
in the meantime , let 's look back at five things we 've learned today :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: council tax increases on the way ?
text: your council tax could go up by an average of £ 75 a year if the police and county council take advantage of new charging powers announced today .
lincolnshire county council today said it was `` minded to '' add an extra 4 % to next year 's bills , but will also consult the public on whether to add even more .

meawnhile the county 's police and crime commissioner marc jones says he will take advantage of a measure announced by the government today which will allow him to charge an extra £ 12 a year for police services .
but mr jones says he 's disappointed with the police funding deal unveiled by policing minister nick hurd .
he says it wo n't address the funding gap in the long-term .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : wild animal collector rejects rewrite of rules
text: a man who keeps his own private wild animal collection in lincolnshire says calls for tighter rules on keeping dangerous animals are not needed .
the rspca says current regulations are n't tough enough and has called for a clampdown on collections like those owned by andrew riddel :
author: Jake Zuckerman
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: dry with sunny spells , but tending to cloud over .
watch my full forecast :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: cash windfall will find urgent stump repairs
text: urgent work can take place at boston stump after the church won a £ 40,000 grant for repairs to the tower roof and clock .
the money , from the national churches trust , is part of a national fund of almost £ 700,000
it 's hoped the work will be complete in time for 2020 - when boston will celebrate the 400th anniversary of the mayflower pilgrims .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: steel starters still joining in scunthorpe
text: while some are looking to their pensions others are just starting their careers in the steel industry .
british steel in scunthorpe is continuing to recruit more manufacturing trainees .
sixty new workers joined the factory this month with another 64 expected to start in january .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: family renew missing appeal almost two decades on
text: the family of a man who went missing in skegness 19 years ago have renewed their appeal for information on his whereabouts .
andrew capon , from grantham , was on a night out with friends when he disappeared .
his daughter tessa has launched a social media campaign to try and find her father which is being backed by lincolnshire police .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: toys r us future plunged into doubt over pension scheme
text: toys r us must put £ 9m into its pension fund by thursday 21 december or face having a restructuring plan rejected .
earlier this month the company said it would close at least 26 uk stores , including the one in scunthorpe .
the pensions protection fund says the firm must pay the cash before it can agree a deal that would prevent 3,200 job loses .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: statue to honour john harrison
text: did you know one north lincolnshire man 's invention saved countless lives at sea ?
john harrison 's marine chronometer enabled sailors to calculate where they were in the ocean .
barrow upon humber residents are now raising £ 70,000 for a bronze statue to be placed in the village in his memory .
author: Clare Crooks
BBC Local Live, Hull

documents.title: revellers encouraged to try zero-alcohol beer
text: people in grimsby are being asked to try non-alcoholic beer - as part of an effort to reduce crime .
humberside police say around half of all crime recorded in the town centre is alcohol related .
north east lincolnshire council have been giving out free samples of zero strength beer to help deal with the problem .
but when i went out with the police to find out what drinkers thought the reaction was pretty mixed .
author: Matthew Bone
Video Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: mps call for strategy to boost steel industry
text: mps are calling for a `` comprehensive strategy '' to boost the steel sector ahead of brexit .
they want ministers to cut energy costs , prevent imports of cheap steel and promote the use of uk steel for major projects .
british steel in scunthorpe used to be owned by tata steel who had their main research and development centre in rotherham .
the labour mp for rotherham , sarah champion , told a special debate in parliament that the government was `` asleep at the wheel '' putting jobs at risk :
the existential crisis the industry has faced in recent years may have begun to subside but many of the long term issues that led it to the preci remain ''
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: road reopened after man hit by car
text: a road where a pedestrian was hit by a car has now reopened .
lincolnshire police say a man in his 80s suffered serious injuries after the incident on lincoln road in north hykeham this morning .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: steel workers pension decision date stands
text: the deadline for british steel workers in scunthorpe to make a decision about the future of their pension will not be extended .
it has been confirmed that former and current staff have until this friday to choose between two new pension plans .
there were calls to put the deadline back over concerns about tight timescales and poor financial advice .
author: Clare Crooks
BBC Local Live, Hull

documents.title: two more alleged drink drivers named by police
text: as part of its continuing campaign to shame people charged with drink driving , lincolnshire police have published two more names this morning .
officers say both men were charged with driving a motor vehicle when above the alcohol limit yesterday .
ivars brencis , 28 , of tamar court , grantham .
was arrested in huntingtower road , grantham , and arturs grieze , 27 , of kedleston road , grantham , was arrested in kedleston road .
they will both appear before lincoln magistrates on january 15 .
five other alleged drink drivers were named by the force yesterday .

documents.title: review to sort out 'confusing ' signs
text: councillors in a lincolnshire town say they 're planning a review of street signs to cut `` confusion '' .
north kesteven district council wants to hear about the worst signs in sleaford town centre .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: bungling would-be robber 'nearly hit by van '
text: a man attempted to rob a shop in grimsby last night .
he threatened staff at the lifestyle express store on weelsby street around 19:00 and demanded money but left with nothing .
armed officers were called to the scene as a matter of precaution .
on leaving the shop the suspect was nearly hit in the road by a white ford transit van and officers would like to speak to that witness .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: city centre road closures to last 80 weeks
text: yes you read that right - lincolnshire county council says restrictions on roads in lincoln city centre will last for more than a year and a half - starting on 8 january .
it 's for a new £ 20m student block which is being built on park street .
nearby mint lane and beaumont fee will also be affected .
a building which has been part of the headquarters of lincoln coffee company stokes ( above ) is being converted into luxury student halls of residence .
stokes moved to new premises earlier this year .
the block will include a concierge service and a cinema according to the company building it .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: transplant patient : i do n't care if surgeon branded me
text: a former patient of a transplant surgeon who 's facing jail after admitting branding the internal organs of two of his patients says he should n't be jailed .
simon bramhall has admitted assault after it emerged he had marked his initials on two transplant patients ' livers using an argon beam .
he carried out a liver transplant on kathryn hodgson , 26 , from grantham , 10 years ago - and she says she does n't care if he did the same to her .
she is now encouraging people to sign a petition which suggests that mr bramhall is not jailed and is instead reinstated to continue his `` lifesaving work '' .
i think that he does n't deserve it in the slightest - yes he may have done this and ok some people do n't agree with it , but when all 's said and done he saved lives ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: new barrier needed at level crossing
text: we 've just heard from network rail which is struggling to get the main a17 between sleaford and boston reopened after a series of problems at a level crossing .
the problems started at around 07:20 when the barrier mechanism failed .
engineers were sent out to repair it and had just finished when a lorry hit one of the barriers .
toby higgins from network rail told bbc radio lincolnshire that means the road will now be closed for some time while a new barrier is delivered .
lincolnshire police are there and have set up a diversion to keep traffic moving .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: road closed after pedestrian hit by car
text: a pedestrian has been injured when they were hit by a vehicle on lincoln road in north hykeham .
the road is closed in both directions .
here 's the latest from the local police :
lincoln road , north hykeham closed between bakewell mews and elizabeth avenue due to a collision .
please avoid the area .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: swineshead delays : vehicle hits barrier
text: the problems on the a17 at the level crossing near swinsehad bridge station have got worse .
network rail , which is responsible for level crossings , says originally the barriers failed .
the firm sent an attendant to work the barriers manually to try and ease the five-mile tailbacks - but then a vehicle hit one of the barriers as it was being lifted .
the barrier has been knocked off - meaning the road will now be closed for some time .
police are setting up diversions .

documents.title: listen : singing to the fish
text: it might sound a bit fishy but i promise this story is true !
every year the grimsby minster choristers sing to the fish at grimsby fish market and it is happening today .
it is a tradition that has been going on for many years as i 've been finding out .
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: seal pup count tops 2,000
text: more than 2,000 seal pups have been born at donna nook on the lincolnshire coast - breaking the previous record .
the latest count of pups born on the beach was 2,024 , the most ever recorded by the lincolnshire wildlife trust , which manages the beach .
donna nook , which is north of mablethorpe , has attracted thousands of visitors this year , causing some problems for locals with traffic .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: swineshead delays : motorists stuck for an hour
text: here 's a tweet from one of the people caught by the level crossing failure on the a17 - long delays being reported .
at the moment five miles of standing traffic is reported .
@ twitterid any danger of someone coming and opening the barriers at swineshead bridge on the a17 so we can all get to work ?
been queuing an hour !
hello dave , can we contact you by phone if it 's safe and you 're still stuck ?
i have cleared i now and managed to turn towards boston but barriers still stuck
apologies , dave .
we are aware of the fault and will be working to fix the issue as quickly as possible .
^ks

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: dry this morning with some bright spells , after a chilly start in places .
watch my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic and travel : level crossing barriers stuck on a17
text: there are long tailbacks on the a17 between sleaford and grantham this morning .
the level crossing barriers are stuck down at swineshead bridge .
network rail engineers are on the way .

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: bank worker admits stealing £ 200,000
text: bank worker admits stealing £ 200,000

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with more news , sport , weather and travel from across the county as it happens .
meanwhile , breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue here throughout the night .
for now , though , i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned on our journey through the day :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: this evening 's weather forecast for lincolnshire
text: dry overnight with clear spells , becoming chilly with a frost forming in places :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cctv image appeal in skegness fraud case probe
text: police investigating a `` complex and lengthy '' fraud case in lincolnshire have issued cctv images of a man who they say may be able to help with their enquiries .
the victim was an elderly resident of a care home in the town who had money withdrawn from a bank account last march via cash machine transactions and shop purchases .
anyone with information , or who can identify the man in the is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: thousands raised for lincolnshire charities at santa fun run
text: not your usual sight in lincoln
this was the scene in the city yesterday as hundreds of santas took part in lincoln 's annual santa fun run .
the organisers say it 's been a big success and it will be back bigger and better next year .
tens of thousands of pounds was raised for local charities .
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: go-ahead expected for barton supermarket and pub plan
text: a decision is expected to be made later on plans for a new supermarket and pub in barton .
the application , by lidl , to build on top field is recommended for approval despite opposition from residents .
lidl says it believes the development would enhance local customer choice and says it 's committed to keeping green areas of the site .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the cat 's pyjamas ? lincoln lion gets festive
text: it seems lincoln arboretum 's lion has been given a christmas makeover courtesy of `` art ninja '' mia monroe :
the lincoln art ninjas are a group of people who go round the city leaving pieces of art to brighten up people 's days !
we certainly love it .
and do n't worry , it turns out the council does too :
what a fantastically quirky artistic endeavour ! ''

documents.title: security warning after rise in burglaries in louth
text: there 's been an increase in the number of burglaries in the louth area , police have warned .
as a result , local residents are being urged to remain vigilant and report any sus activities .
to make homes even more secure , police are advising people to close their curtains when it becomes dark , lock doors and make sure all security lights work .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: pre-christmas move for city park and ride
text: lincoln 's park and ride service is on the move
from today until saturday , the buses will operate from bishop grosseteste university rather than their current base at waitrose .
the move is to allow spaces in the car park to be used by waitrose customers during the final run-up to christmas .
author: Maggie Curtis
News Editor, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : this week 's weather forecast
text: it 'll stay dry for the rest of this afternoon in our part of the world - and high pressure looks set to dominate this week .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: boy in court over air weapon and blade
text: a boy charged with possessing an air weapon and a blade at a lincolnshire school with intent to cause fear of violence has appeared at lincoln youth court .
the 13-year-old , who ca n't be named because of his age , was arrested last month in the south of the county .
he 's been remanded in custody and is expected to appear in court again on 12 january .

documents.title: sounds of christmas fill lincoln cathedral
text: about 1,000 people filled lincoln cathedral last night for a very special christmas carol service .
the bbc radio lincolnshire event featured readings , carols and performances by the cathedral choristers and the band of the raf college .
if you missed it , no need to fret : the whole service will be broadcast from 10:00 on christmas day on bbc radio lincolnshire .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln a & e still under pressure despite more staff
text: doctors at lincoln county hospital a & e say the department is still coming under pressure from large numbers of patients , even though more staff have been recruited .
doctors there treat about 9,000 more patients a year than eight years ago and government waiting time targets have n't been met there since 2014 .
earlier this year , people were asked to stay away from the unit unless it was an emergency .
staffing levels have improved , but doctors are still having to treat many people who do n't need emergency care .
eight years ago , we were contracted to see 63,000 patients a year .
this year we 'll have seen nearer 72,000 . ''
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: overturned lorry causing delays on a1
text: there are delays near newark because of an overturned lorry on the a1 northbound .
# a1 is now closed in both directions between the # a52 # grantham and # a46 # newark-on-trent due to an overturned lorry which has crossed over the carriageway .
oh what a surprise another incident involving a lorry worst drivers on the road
lorry hater .
you got it
yup , they are without doubt a pain in arse on the roads .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: cctv appeal after phones stolen in boston
text: lincolnshire police are appealing for information after a number of mobile phones were stolen from the vodafone shop on strait bargate in boston .
it happened at about 16:00 on friday 1 december .
officers say they want to speak to the four men below .
if you know who these men are or have any information about the theft , please contact the police .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police investigate three suspected arson attacks
text: three suspected arson attacks are being investigated by police in grimsby .
all the incidents happened in east marsh between 21:30 and 22:00 on tuesday 12 december .
rubbish was deliberately set alight close to properties in victor street ( stanage walk and tom hammond way , police believe .
all the fires were safely extinguished and nobody was injured .

documents.title: crews tackle fire at farm
text: fire crews have been called to a blaze at a farm near grantham .
about 25 firefighters are currently tackling the fire at manor farm in bassingthorpe .

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom today include :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: your lunchtime weather
text: if you 're popping out on your lunch break , it 's looking chilly out there in lincolnshire .
here 's the latest forecast :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police defend drink-drive name-and-shame tactic
text: from today , if you 're caught and charged with drink-driving in lincolnshire you 'll be named by police on social media .
it marks the start of the force 's think do n't drink campaign over the festive period .
critics argue the police are acting as judge and jury by officially naming those charged with drink-driving .
but police say the names of those facing prosecution do still appear in publicly accessible court listings :
the information is in the public domain .
it 's just about how we use it to try and persuade people to not commit that offence in the first place . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: foreign language speakers sought by police
text: people who speak polish , latvian or lithuanian as well as being fluent in english are being sought by lincolnshire police .
the force hopes the drive will help it to improve its service to communities across the county , particularly in boston and south holland .
more information about how to apply can be found on the lincolnshire police website .
chief constable bill skelly says language barriers can often prevent officers from giving the best service to communities who speak limited english :
it 's essential we bridge these gaps with our communities and we 'll continue to put the right people with the right skills in positions where they can make a huge difference . ''
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakingbody find linked to teenager 's disappearance
text: the discovery of a body in lincolnshire is being linked to the disappearance of a teenager who went missing after a night out in cleethorpes .
police investigating the whereabouts of 19-year-old liam toner say the body of a young man was found at holton-le-clay just before midnight on saturday .
the death is being treated as unexplained .
author: Clare Crooks
BBC Local Live, Hull

documents.title: over £ 16k raised as pudsey goes viking
text: you may remember that last month the team at bbc radio lincolnshire undertook quite a challenge .
breakfast presenter scott dalton and newsreader corazon garcia walked the 147-mile viking way for children in need .
there were some difficulties along the way , with both scott and corazon having to take breaks due to some sizable blisters and sheer exhaustion .
but , with a little help from the rest of the bbc radio lincolnshire family , they got to the end .
yesterday was the final day to donate to the cause and i can reveal the final total was £ 16,020.91 .
not bad at all !
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: butlins site among landmarks protected by historic england
text: the gardens where billy butlin opened his first holiday camp are among 20 unusual sites granted protected status by historic england .
skegness esplanade and tower gardens were opened in 1936
a total of 1,041 historic sites have been given listed status in 2017 , the government 's heritage agency said .
other landmarks include a roman parade ground and acoustic mirrors used to detect aircraft prior to the invention of radar .
the agency said 99 % of people live within a mile of a listed site .
author: David McKenna
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: weather watchers : frosty morning in stixwould
text: this is the reason i ask you to send in your photos
what a beautiful shot of a frosty morning near the old stixwould station by bbc weather watcher len :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: cowley keen to complete rowe deal
text: lincoln city manager danny cowley says he 's keen to complete a deal for ipswich midfielder danny rowe .
last week , ipswich manager mick mccarthy revealed that rowe was set to join the imps on loan in january for the rest of the season .
author: Su Whitaker
BBC Radio Lincolnshire Sport

documents.title: drink-drivers to be named by police
text: from today , you 'll be named on social media if you 're charged with drink-driving in lincolnshire .
it 's all part of lincolnshire police 's think do n't drink campaign :
the force says it hopes it will make people think twice before getting behind the wheel .
a recent study by the press association found that lincolnshire police charges more offenders than anywhere else in the uk .
between november 2016 and december 2017 , the force made more than 1,000 arrests for drink-driving and more than 150 arrests for driving under the influence of drugs .
nearly 70 % of those people were charged .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: welcome to monday 's coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
hope here , ready to bring you the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county as it happens .
got something happening near you ?
or simply want to get in touch ?
well , i 'd love to hear from you .
you can get in touch by sending an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire
